docTitle.titlePart:
Server Clusters : Architecture Overview
For Windows Server 2003

front.div:
Abstract
Server clusters are one of two Microsoft Windows clustering technologies available for the Microsoft Windows
Server family of products. Windows Server 2003 clusters provide failover support for back-end applications and
services that require high availability and data integrity. These back-end applications include enterprise
applications such as database, file server, enterprise resource planning (ERP), and messaging systems. This white
paper focuses on the architecture and features of the cluster service and describes its terminology, concepts,
design goals, key components, and planned future directions.
